page.title: 17Cloddach Quarry.
page.content: Our first impression of Cloddach Quarry was of sandy hills,machinery and deserted landscape.However this hid an unexpected abundance of bird life.As we approached we were surprised to find an oyster catcher sitting on 3 eggs in a small depression in gravel only metres from the office door.Further away from the vehicles and machinery were several large ponds of water.One,thick with reeds had made ideal nesting cover for water birds.Pairs of mallards and coots with young moved quietly among the reeds.Many nests,including a swan's,were seen.Above wheeled black_ headed,common and herring gulls while others watched from low hills.A pair of swans and six cygnets swam nearby. The secluded quarry provided an ideal site for large nesting birds.
